semantic_title: Antimicrobial Drug Resistance (Z16) - Sequencing with Infection Codes
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 21. Factors Influencing Health Status > c. Categories of Z Codes > 3) Status

content.full_text: This category indicates that a patient has a condition that is resistant to antimicrobial drug treatment. Sequence the infection code first. (Evidence: pg no: 94, L35-L36)
content.summary: Z16 codes indicate antimicrobial drug resistance and must be sequenced after the infection code (Evidence: pg no: 94, L35-L36)
key_concepts: Antimicrobial drug resistance (Evidence: pg no: 94, L35-L36)
Infection code sequenced first (Evidence: pg no: 94, L36)
Secondary diagnosis usage (Evidence: pg no: 94, L36)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Sequence the infection code first (Evidence: pg no: 94, L36)
detailed_rules.explanation: When coding antimicrobial resistance, the underlying infection must be the principal or first-listed diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 94, L36)

workflow_steps: Step 2: Assign appropriate infection code as principal diagnosis
Step 3: Assign Z16 code as secondary diagnosis

code_ranges.description: Resistance to antimicrobial drugs (Evidence: pg no: 94, L34)
code_ranges.requirement: Must be sequenced after infection code
usage_rules: Sequence infection code first (Evidence: pg no: 94, L36)

coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient diagnosed with pneumonia due to methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA).
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify pneumonia as primary condition
Step 2: Assign pneumonia code as principal diagnosis
Step 3: Assign Z16 code for methicillin resistance

correct_coding.sequencing: Infection code first, then resistance code
correct_coding.rationale: Infection must be sequenced before resistance code (Evidence: pg no: 94, L36)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Resistance code cannot be principal diagnosis
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Sequencing resistance code before infection code

warnings: Never sequence Z16 codes before infection codes (Evidence: pg no: 94, L36)
best_practices: Use Z16 codes as secondary diagnoses only
common_mistakes: Using resistance codes without infection codes
tips: Remember infection always comes first in sequencing
